quest.name: The Doma Within
journal: Lyse is more determined than ever to play her part.
objectives: Search the House of the Fierce for people in need.
Search the ruins for usable weapons.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Dairyu Moon Gates have guarded the approach to Doma Castle since long before the imperial occupation.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We do not anticipate any great difficulty in gaining entry to the gatehouse as our Doman friends know its every nook and cranny. The challenge will come in preserving the element of surprise. But I am confident the shinobi will rise to the occasion.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: During the rebellion, the imperials turned to their agents among the shinobi, and through their treachery were many of my comrades slaughtered.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: We few who survived have not forgotten that day. The memory of it has spurred us never to neglect our training, that we might be ready to administer revenge.

dialogue.name: ISSE
dialogue.text: I didn't think we'd have another chance so soon, but here we are. We're going to beat them this time. We have to!

dialogue.name: TSURANUKI
dialogue.text: All the armor I can provide, you will have. I will labor until I can no longer lift my hammer!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Even after twenty-five years of oppression, they still have it in them to stand up and fight. We just have to show them the way forward...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Isse and I will stay and help Tsuranuki finish the armor, so you've no need to wait around.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Why not go back to the House of the Fierce? I'm sure there's plenty of work left to be done. Ask about and see what you can find!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Right! Where are the hammers? Just show me what needs hammering!

dialogue.name: KAIDATE
dialogue.text: Everything is in order, misssir! Under Lord Gosetsu's sage tutelage, we grow stronger by the day!

dialogue.name: KAIDATE
dialogue.text: We will acquit ourselves with honor on the battlefield! This I swear!

dialogue.name: MOTOJIRO
dialogue.text: Hm? Help? Oh, no, no, no─I will not impose upon you without cause! Rest assured that everything is in its place, and every place is in...everything is fine!

dialogue.name: MOTOJIRO
dialogue.text: Beneath the armor, an imperial is a man like any other. But magitek armor is different. Without the right tactics and equipment, we will be hard-pressed...

dialogue.name: HANAME
dialogue.text: I require no assistance, comrade. Lord Hien's instructions to me were quite clear─I need only transcribe them for the benefit of our Xaela allies.

dialogue.name: HANAME
dialogue.text: Speaking of Lord Hien, if you are eager to be of service, mayhap you could seek him out? Keep an eye on him, perchance, should he decide to venture outside?

dialogue.name: HANAME
dialogue.text: Like you, Lord Hien is not given to idleness. He may go whither he will, of course, but I do fear for his safety...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Hmm, let me guess: someone asked you to act as my protector? Hah! To hear them mutter, one would think I intended to stride up to the castle gates on my own!

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: The truth, of course, is rather less dramatic. I had hoped to look on the castle one last time before the battle. Would you care to join me? You would be setting a lot of fretful minds at rest...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Very good! Then let us depart for Monzen at once.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Monzen was home to many great and powerful families. Men of honor─samurai. Once...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Great swaths were razed, and people put to the sword. What little remains stands as a testament to what was...and what will never be again.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: ...Come. I would take a closer look.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: No sentries, at least of the living sort. Those shambling suits of armor have the run of the place. To think this was once a bustling street, so full of life...a river of people, with a current all its own...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: ...But even then, the imperials walked among us. Sometimes openly, sometimes discreetly, but we were always aware of their presence. And we...we were complicit.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: He did what he had to do to preserve the peace. To keep our people safe. But at what cost...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: F-Forgive me, this is neither the time nor the place for such dark musings! Though they did serve to remind me of the barracks which once stood to the west of here...where there may yet be weapons our comrades could use.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: If you head down that street, past those makeshift barricades, you will come to the ruins. I will search elsewhere. Meet me at the water's edge when you have finished.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Alas, I found naught of value. Did you?

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Still sheathed in its scabbard...though even shielded from the elements, it will need to be cleaned and oiled─

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: ...I recognize the crest. It belonged to the son of a samurai I trained with when I was young.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: He never even had the chance to draw it...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: There she is. Doma Castle. My home.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: They let us keep her for a time, before gradually moving their forces across from Fluminis. Now her every court and corridor belongs to Yotsuyu.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Though Father spent much of his time there, I did not. I may only have visited him there on half a dozen occasions, if that. I cannot remember.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: But I remember the view from the keep. Doma seemed much smaller from there. Like you could hold it in your hands.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Well, Monzen at least. Doma is so much more than that. There, beyond the Moon Gates, unto the shores of the Ruby Sea, and here, in the places that no man can see or touch or take from you...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: We carry her with us, wheresoever we go.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Not the land or the soil...but the story.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: And what is life if not a story? The story of our journey from dawn to dusk, day after day after day. The story of our mothers and our fathers, our families and our friends, our peoples and our nations.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text:
I think a part of me understood that, when I looked out from the keep.
Hien, son of Kaien. Another caretaker of the story of Doma.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: It's a fine castle, truly, with an even finer view. But in the end...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: In...in the end...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Kami strike me down, how could I be so blind! We must return to the House of the Fierce at once!

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: I have had what can only be described as a revelation. Ours is an excellent plan, but not so excellent that it cannot be improved─and I know how.
